除.definition: to get rid of; to remove; to exclude; to eliminate; to wipe out; to divide; except; not including

除了.definition: besides; apart from (... also...); in addition to; except (for)

除冰.definition: to defrost; to get rid of ice

除去.definition: to eliminate; to remove; except for; apart from

除名.definition: to strike off (the rolls); to remove from a list; to expunge; to expel

除塵.definition: to eliminate dust (i.e. filter out suspended particles)

除外.definition: to exclude; not including sth (when counting or listing); except for

除惡務盡.definition: to eradicate evil completely (idiom); thorough in rooting out wickedness

除暴安良.definition: to root out the strong and give people peace (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor

除根.definition: to root out; to eliminate the roots; to cure once and for all

除此之外.definition: apart from this; in addition to this

除淨.definition: to remove completely; to eliminate; to cleanse from

除祟.definition: to drive out devils and spirits exorcism

除舊布新.definition: to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate

除舊更新.definition: to replace the old with new (idiom)

除邪.definition: to guard against evil; to exorcise

除開.definition: besides; except; to get rid of (sb); (math.) to divide

除靈.definition: to expel spirits; (old) to end the period of mourning

除非.definition: only if (..., or otherwise, ...); only when; only in the case that; unless
